timeline.message: support adding of restriction columns as well as changing priority
add method to upgrade the current task table
save restriction and populate when populating entity from database
strip date format for unit tests
set restriction only if period or repititions are set
Reinit core Library and context singleton after each test
Reinit core Library and context singleton after each test

timeline.bodyText: Isn't this an Integer field as declared on line 108?
timeline.author: Rkareko

timeline.bodyText: on line 92 Priority has been changed from an integer field to a varchar. Do we need a migration for that?
timeline.author: Rkareko

replies.bodyText: The table is being recreated using DatabaseMigrationUtils.recreateSyncTableWithExistingColumnsOnly above, this is because sqlite does not support alter column data types or dropping columns, the table must be recreated
replies.author: githengi

timeline.bodyText: Drop priority column and readd it as varchar column type
timeline.author: ekigamba

replies.bodyText: I have updated this to Integer
replies.author: githengi

replies.bodyText: Migration of priority column since on running apps its an integer
replies.author: ekigamba

timeline.bodyText: Change this type to INTEGER and the restriction_end type also. This is queried as long on line 313. Similar changes on line 131 for migration scripts. Also when saving in the ContentValue

timeline.bodyText:
Not sure how this works with 2019-03-31T0000. Could you confirm? Is the T0000 part essential and/or ignored during conversion?
Found the format in CampaignTest
timeline.author: ekigamba

replies.bodyText: This for plans serialization, and deserialization, plans use Dates and thus dont need the time part. Since the execution period was changed from Localdate to DateTime, this is necessary to avoid side effects
replies.author: githengi
